placeDesc: Albert, the World’s Largest Bull, has stood in Audubon, Iowa since 1964. At 30 feet tall and 33 feet long, he has a 15-foot span between his horns. He also has baby blue eyes and giant concrete gonads, often whimsically repainted by folks celebrating various events. The audio in the kiosk is informative.
placeRelatedPlaces: ["'Mullum Mullum the Owl'", 'Josie Lyon Statue and Grave', 'Lyhdynkantajat (The Lantern Bearers)', 'Scioto Lounge Deer Sculptures']
